Got the daily special (Eggs Benedict) with a coffee. Nothing special but service was fast and friendly and it was a clean place. We sat at the window looking into the garage with the creepy stereotypical Native which was odd.

I have gone back four times now. Pastrami - the very best I have ever had. Meatloaf - very good but not superior (I would order it again though). Tuna salad - very good. A burger - exceptional. But you really have to get the apple pie with a slice of cheese. Real apples with some crunch and a pile of them. The crust is not just pushed up by steam it is full of apples. Coffee? I grew up ranching and yes that is ranch coffee. So it is now a regular for me and I really like the friendly contact of the owner and his wife. I like that I can sit in there until 3:00 pm and work. The WiFi is seamless and the music is not so loud you can't think. This is a family diner and it harkens back to when people spoke to each other. I love it.

Best pancakes, sorry Matt's big Breakfast, it's true.  Good breakfast choices, local ingredients and Melrose Small Business makes it a hit.  They have Cholula & a special California, chili only sauce that is very tasty.  I only recommend they add Chilaquiles to the menu because I am selfish and I love Chilaquies or Southwestern style Migas. 
Give this place a shot, the new location on 7th Ave. makes it a bit more convenient and the food is good.

We had just landed in Phoenix to start our vacay and were starving for breakfast. Luckily Joe's Diner was open - lucky for us! It is nice and cozy inside - seating and a bar area to add to the diner appeal. The food was made to order and came out pretty quickly (though we were so hungry it couldn't come quick enough!)! Hubs ordered the breakfast burrito - it was the biggest, thickest burrito I've ever seen - and we are from Texas where burritos reign supreme! I ordered eggs and a waffle - both were perfect. The service was with a smile and the owner, Joe, even came over and chatted with us for about 10 minutes about family and how he ended up running a diner. The ambiance can't be beat and the food is great too! We didn't get to try the pancakes on this trip, but next time we will have to for sure! This will definitely become a permanent stop for us every time we are in Phoenix :)

The location is central, good parking, and internal ambiance is very nice and friendly.  All waitstaff were very helpful, pleasant, and happy to be there.  Very crowded on a Sunday morning, so get there early to avoid the rush.  Food is what you would expect from a diner--prepared by the kitchen, but does not taste like it is home-made.  Maybe "home prepared" from food-service supplier ingredients?  Pancakes and Belgian waffles are really good.  Potatoes are great.  CFS was more of a breaded, seasoned hamburger patty than anything.

Great food, good prices, and usually no wait.  However, the past few times I've gone in I've ordered their delicious biscuits and gravy only to be told when they were brining out my friends' food that they were out of biscuits and I could either wait 20-30 minutes or order something else (and still wait). 

That being said, it is still a good place to get breakfast (I've never gone their for lunch) and has a pretty good selection of breakfast foods.

Can't say enough good things about this place...from the service, to the atmosphere, to the food, everything was EXCELLENT!! Visiting the area from Ohio, and so glad we stopped here!! 
LOVED IT!!

The pancakes are the best that I have eaten in Phoenix.  Also it is one of our favorites in our area of town for breakfast.  The owner, Joe, stopped by our table to greet us and is almost always there to make sure everything is perfect.  It is a great local and family owned business.  We also thought the coffee was great for a breakfast place.
The best pancakes I've ever had ... the cinnamon rolls are pretty killer to ...

I'm not shitting you, this wasTHEEEE best breakfast I've ever had!

The pancakes are OUT OF THIS WORLD and the coffee is great.

I had the Eggs Benedict which was really good, due in most part to the really tasty ham. 

Unfortunately I did not order any pancakes but kept stealing bites from my girl's plate. Without question the best pancakes I've ever tasted.

I can not wait to go back!

The food was o . k .... Seems like the regulars get special treatment . And if this is the first time you came in , you are pretty much ignored . I had to remind my waitress about silver wear , my meal , my check . She never asked me if I needed anything . I am very easy to please . This is my first negative review I have ever written . This is a shame because I like to patronize my neighbor restaurants . I will not be back .

I live across the street from this place and which I had gone when I first moved in.  I've been several times now and would like to consider myself a "regular"  I can come and and see Amanda and she knows exactly what I want.  THE CHORIZO BISCUITS AND GRAVY.  That stuff is amazing.  My last time there, the owner sat down with us and talked to us about how to make the gravy.  He clearly knows his food and loves what he does.  Kind of a random location, but def worth stopping in.

Have been a frequent diner here and just can't do it any longer. I swear if any business was in need of an overhaul of waitstaff and timing it's here. 

It always starts with such promise. Time to sit and look at menu and someone brings you a drink. Then you order and the hell begins...

An hour this time (on a Thursday at 10:30) we ordered from the menu no changes. That's when the server disappeared. 38 minutes later she reappeared with two plates of food which she quickly deposited and booked it away. 

Want to know why?  Because our food was so cold except the bottom from the heating plate. Butter wouldn't melt on pancakes but it would spread. Ugh really?  Guess what happens then?  Yep 17 minutes of trying to get her to come on by. Finally she does and we get it taken off the bill. Not like we ate any of it. Seriously has this place really given up? Too bad. 

Save your time and go anywhere else

Had breakfast here after an early morning flight.  It's not fancy but the waitress was nice and the food was good too.  Had an omelette and some pancakes.  Omelette was what you would expect but the pancakes were really good!

Great place for breakfast.  But as good as the food is, and it's terrific, the wait staff and owners make you feel right at home.  Super service.  Bright, clean, large 50's-style diner.  Lots of regulars.  The customers know the staff and the staff definitely knows their customers.
They serve Arbuckle's cofffee!!!  The pancakes, biscuits, and potatoes are top notch.

We have met the owner a few times on our visits...nice guy but i just cant suggest this place. yes, the chorizo gravy and biscuits is delicious and the prices are good, but i have gotten sick as well as some of the sloooooowest service on multiple occasions. avoid.

Finally made it back and thought it was so so. Maybe I should have ordered something else. I had the omelet with ham, cheese, green pepper, and tomatoes and a short stack of pancakes.

It tasted ok, but wasn't really an omelet. the ingredients weren't folded inside, they were mixed in with the eggs. Like scrambled eggs. And then cooked and folded over but it was broken it half. 

It came with home fries which tasted ok too but they were 8/10 on the grease factor. 
The marbled rye toast was flawless. And the coffee tasted good too, although the waitress took a while to refill. I didn't like the pancakes much. Very thin and the batter was a little chewy inside. But the syrup they have on the table was great. Better than average for artificial. 

Overall this place was not horrible but the food wasn't good enough for me to return. I honestly prefer the omelets at Denny's.

It was a Diner.  Service was ok and definitely over priced for what they serve.  I ordered the two eggs and bacon with potatoes and the plate was half of potatoes.  The eggs were over cooked and patty style, and these were my scrambled eggs.  Told the waitress they were over cooked and just blew it off and took my plate.  26 dollars for two, way to much.  First time, last time.

01/20/11

It doesn't take much to talk me into trying a new breakfast joint... I've a list of restaurants that were bookmarked YEARS ago, and I've yet to step into those places to order my first meals there, and yet, I read a couple of enthusiastic yelp reviews about Joe's Diner, and I'm there w/in a week or less, savoring for myself forkfuls of those delicious pancakes I read about, but there I go, getting ahead of myself...

Delighted in finding ample parking (I think I arrived around 1030a or so), I walked into Joe's Diner pleasantly surprised to find a cozy 50s-, 60s-style diner.  Yes, yes, I read all about the atmosphere here, and I was still a little disconcerted, coming in from the open-air parking lot, but pleasantly so.  I liked some of the memorabilia, but I don't know what to make of the outdoor decor-- roofed and cemented empty garage w/ the parked truck?  Seems like wasted space to me- perhaps this is where the weekend overflow goes...  I initially was directed to the more-crowded room at the back of the diner, but it was much darker in there, and I wanted light (!), so I asked if I could have a booth in the more-spacious front.  "Sure," the hostess said, w/out blinking an eye, and I was already off to a great start.

Couldn't decide what to have, so I decided to order the items that appealed most-- biscuits and gravy, pancakes w/ a side of fresh strawberry compote, and Thursday's lunch special of lasagna.  Ordered a cup of deliciously strong Arbuckles coffee, too.  The sausage and biscuits came out relatively fast-- good to note if you're really hungry and you want something quick! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/53jjJCXpXSRaHfu_ZJePRA?select=LkEf3z8DxtMVZbRY-2E9tA#LkEf3z8DxtMVZbRY-2E9tA  I didn't care much for the biscuits, though.  Found them to be too tender.  (I like my biscuits to buckle, not crumble, a bit when I dig in w/ my fork.)  I'd requested the regular sausage to be substituted w/ chorizo, and the gravy was nicely done.  Too bad about the biscuits...  I next tried the lasagna... http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/53jjJCXpXSRaHfu_ZJePRA?select=CB1MtmdiQS9wvpePLAUcBw#CB1MtmdiQS9wvpePLAUcBw  Wow!  I really enjoyed the bites I had sampled.  The pasta was al dente- tender, yet had a nice bite to it; the filling was well-seasoned, yet not too salty-- meat was chunky, and the ricotta portion was generous; and the garlic bread that accompanied the entree was warm, perfectly crusty, and deliciously buttered.  I wouldn't mind returning back on a Thursday to have this dish again.  Last, but certainly not least, the pancakes!!  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/53jjJCXpXSRaHfu_ZJePRA?select=cD_SaPRv1RkiWivD6qBQBw#cD_SaPRv1RkiWivD6qBQBw  Portion seemed small- there wasn't much of a rise, so I mistakenly thought the platter was of a short stack, but the server asked me to lift all cakes to see for myself.  Yep!  I counted three.  These cakes tasted amazing, and all they needed were a tiny bit of butter and simple toppings of macerated strawberries (I had to ask for a second serving of fruit).  Now, I wouldn't mind returning any day of the week to have a stack of these carb-delights!

Cool retro decor; warm and friendly service, a bit relaxed in pace; and two out of three knock-out entrees on the first try put Joe's Diner on my list to visit again soon!  I'd take out-of-town guests here in a heartbeat!

Wow, came here yesterday for breakfast since I was in the area and the place is cool.  It is a very good sized location and I thought the window to the business next door was very cool from the inside.  It is very 50's looking diner with a good size parking lot and the service was great also.  My waiter recommended trying the pancakes so I did and they were phenomenal.  I ordered the number 2 which comes with bacon, sausage, eggs, & pancakes.... the plate was just to much to finish but I had to eat all the pancakes because they were so darn good.  This place has a nice atmosphere and you feel very comfortable reading the newspaper and having a quiet breakfast.  I cant believe that the place has not been open for a year yet either.

What a great experience. The food was amazing, especially the biscuits and gravy. Coffee is fresh and tasty. The best part is the owners Joe and his wife. Joe came to the table and spoke of the local ingredienta he uses to prepare his yummy food. This is great place!

We had a positive experience our first time into Joe's Diner. They had a ton of parking, friendly hostess, and solid food. I tried the corn beef hash and it was just what I wanted. Great little gem and nice alternative to Melrose Kitchen or 5th Avenue Cafe

Went here based on the yelp reviews.. It was not disappointing. I had the biscuits and gravy (chorizo gravy) and my boyfriend had the chicken fried steak. We got there so early we even got to eat breakfast with Joe (the owner).. I recommend!!

Took "the Fam"  and grandkids( Yes, Jeannie has grandkids) to Joe's for breakfast.  Not only did we leave without a huge dent in my wallet, we all left pleasantly stuffed!  If you like bacon, order like 5 sides of it.  You won't want to share this pig perfection! Thumbs up were given by all....French toast, breakfast burrito, pancakes, and cinnamon buns were all gobbled down.  My son and I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  We both devoured them like Evil Skeksis! The biscuits are super soft and they have the gravy just right. I would go there and just eat that each time...for 2.99!!!!  It was more than enough food too.

Check it out!
Always friendly and have yet to be disappointed in their breakfast. Have tried almost everything on breakfast menu...great!!

Perfect!  Great breakfast! No complaints!

Pretty busy morning, but the staff kept us full and happy! I enjoyed my corn beef and hash with eggs...something you don't find on the menu at all restaurants. The only complaint I had was the d-bag behind me...who complained about everything in his life. Having D-bags for customers is no fault of the restaurant so no dedctuctions of points there.

I order the same thing every time.  Corned beef hash. I ask them every time I like my eggs over medium, hate runny whites.   Finally asked owner how come no one in your kitchen can cook an over medium egg? His response is it's impossible.  Really?  I can cook them and yet a diner owner says it's impossible.   Maybe he miss understood me but my wife was right there and she just looked at me in disbelief.  Also they rave about their biscuits and gravy and let me tell you they are average at best.

Service is friendly, pancakes are great.

I had the veggie omelet, and it was alright, really nothing special.  It does come with home fries cooked in bacon, which would have been nice to know.  I only found out because I notice the bacon in my home fries.  Small menu, not a lot of choices, only one lunch vegetarian option.  I probably won't be back, but I wouldn't avoid the place.

Ehhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

I was really hoping to find a local diner with delicious breakfast that I could go to with three of my best friend, my Seinfield diner if you will, but unfortunately, this just wasn't the case. 

The inside is like a small Village Inn. very typical, very boring, and no pie. 

Our server seemed extremely overwhelmed, even though it wasn't super busy (we came in for a late breakfast). She was pleasant, but nothing exceptional about the service. We ordered pretty basic breakfast items, and it took an exceptionally long time to get our food.

I ordered the number two, which had sausage, bacon, pancakes, and eggs, which is a lot of food. Unfortunately, it wasn't great. Both my pancakes and sausage had been burned. I was happy to have the bacon as a back up which thankfully, was cooked perfectly. The eggs were pretty basic, but I didn't have to make them so they were worth it. I stole a few potatoes from my boyfriend, and I will say, they definitely know how to make breakfast potatoes. this should 100% be your side choice. 

The best part about this is they definitely don't skimp on the orange juice. I did get a giant glass of OJ which was ..orangey. 

In my opinion, it was a little overpriced for the quality of the food, but you will definitely get a lot of food on your plate.
Enjoyed my breakfast and the device was excellent. Was honored to actually meet Joe. Happy to have you in the neighborhood.

Went for a quick bite while waiting for my puppy at the vet.

-my wife ordered scrambled eggs with bacon and potatoes. The eggs appeared like the powdered eggs patients receive at the VA (tasted like them too). The bacon was barely warm. It was also dry as though it had been resting under a heat lamp. For the price, I expect fresh product rather than food that was clearly sitting out after being prepared.

I had a burger and fries. The fries were fair, however the burger was greasy and sloppy. The worst part was the bun which was also greasy, not crisp and was dense. Less than 20 minutes later as I write this review, my stomach already hurts. 

On leaving, my wife stopped in the rest room. She reports that it looked like a bathroom from a carnival or truck stop.

Suffice it to say, I won't be returning. Overall, it was a greasy disgusting mess.

After many attempts of having restaurants succeed on the corner of 16th and Campbell (people seem to think that the whole building is an autobody shop) I hope that Joe's works out.

I went there for the first time on Saturday...just decided to walk over and try them out.  Had eggs, bacon, and one pancake.  Everything was made delicious...and I have to highly recommend the pancakes!  I came back on Sunday to just have them again!  

The owner, Joe and his wife Joan (I had to make fun of that...good sports) are very personable and full of excitement for their new venture.  Joe has stories behind each one of his dishes.  It was endearing.

The only thing that they have to work on is there service before you order and after. (During they are great!) It could take awhile for you to be noticed to be either seated or for you to order your food.  And getting your check? Make sure you ask for it during your meal.  You may just get it on time.

This is our go to breakfast spot for so many reasons great food, friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere they have tables and a counter. Their homemade jellies are delicious and you must try their breakfast potatoes. Great customer service!!

Hostess not welcoming, staff running around trying to fix Order mix-ups, computer problems, orders delayed, etc. Joe, the owner runs around the place with his hair on fire making things worse. Really off-putting. Food is pretty good though. Definitely a frustrating and tense breakfast place.

Great little hidden diner right on 16th st. Monte Cristo's are on point. The muffalata is good (would be better with authentic bread, not a hoagie). Nice staff. Old school feel. Great prices. I'll be back for sure.

Meatloaf special (Tuesday's) was very good.  Comes with mashed potatoes.  Coffee was very good too.  This is a fun, old-school diner with servers who've probably been there 20+ years and cooks who know how to work a griddle.

Prices are extremely reasonable ($0.70 for a side of one fried egg).

I'd enjoyed Joe's Diner in its old location and was feeling good about checking it out in its newer, more convenient spot. Huge portions, good food, good service, what's not to like?

After I'd waited a while at the "please wait to be seated" sign, a server called out that she'd get to me in a minute, then went off to take the order of a large table. Okay, maybe they'd been waiting a while, and if you don't get that in to the kitchen, things bog down. Then another server came over and asked which of us in the foyer was first. "Me," I said. The father with two kids behind me said: "She is."

The server then looked right past me, picked up three menus, and went to seat the party behind me, the same party that was clearly puzzled and embarrassed to be seated first when they'd said it was my turn.

My strong suspicion, since I'm very tall and had gone for retro-glam in high-heeled mules and a large hat, was that the staff jumped to the erroneous conclusion that I was either a drag queen or transgender. That's an excellent reason for me to not spend money there: I live in a queer-friendly neighborhood because I like those values (whether I need them to apply to me or not) and there are plenty of places I'm more comfortable supporting.

Just noticed this place for the first time and stopped in to try it out. My wife and I were both impressed with the food and service. We had the veg omelet, it came out fast and it was great. The bread (toast) is fresh baked and the jam is home made. The owner stopped at our table to see how we liked eveything. We both got a great vibe and great food, we'll be back frequently I'm sure.

Excellent food. Cooked my eggs correctly the FIRST time. Pancakes...awesome. Biscuits with Chorizo Gravy...awesome. Prices were fair. Would like to see a few more options but hey, that they have is working. 
Service was excellent. Both waitress in duty this morning were very nice and pleasant but not over the top. 
You have to try this place.

Good but not great. Chicken fried steak was a food supplier patty but the sausage gravy was home made and very tasty. Potatoes were under cooked but eggs were perfect. A $14 breakfast. They need to step it up and prepare everything fresh or take it off the menu. Going back to try the pancakes.

I believe I already left a review for Joes, but if I didn't then here it goes. The owners here are super nice humble friendly professional business owners. I love their pancakes. They are literally the best pancakes I have had, and they are for sure homemade no boxed pancakes here. The food is consistently good. The servers here are prompt. Even if you order takeout the quality does not suffer. Joes is always a good idea. I have never been disappointed in all my years of coming here. It is always money well spent. Every time! Eat at Joes!

I had been here once about a year ago when I first moved to the neighborhood but never reviewed them. I went back again on Thursday for breakfast. The staff was super friendly, I believe the owners were actually waiting tables and both were great. Its a sort of greasy spoon. The only meat they have is pork no turkey bacon or chicken sausage or even beef so if your not a pork eater you will not be eating meat here. I ordered a combo it had pancakes , eggs and potatoes. The pancakes were really good probably the best thing I ordered. The potatoes were seasoned well but not hot and the eggs were okay. Its not fancy at all but absolutely serves its purpose for breakfast and good service always helps. Our bill was $28 which isn't bad but also kinda high for a greasy spoon. I probably won't go here regularly but when I feel like good pancakes close to home I would definitely think of Joes.

So I had an extra early am appt before work and was done quickly. Consequently I was way early for work and wanted to stop and have a sit down breakfast. Of course I turn to yelp since I was in an unfamiliar area. It's hard to find a good old fashioned diner instead of coffee joints these days. The first place I stopped was a coffee joint...*strike* the counter guy was nice but that'll be another review lol. Next I found Joe's Diner. I walked in about 0645 and there were about 4 other diners seated. It smelled slightly musty probably because they just mopped so I can't complain about that. It's nice and clean inside. The smell didn't last at all and wasn't overbearing The server was very friendly.  I received a menu, items are very well priced ($ as posted on yelp) I decided on the corn beef hash because it came with 3 eggs and 1 biscuit and gravy. When the food came I received the eggs and b&g but got a slice of ham instead of the corn beef hash. She was apologetic and took and replaced it. She left the biscuit and gravy so could start with that, which I might say was *awesome!* I asked for the chorizo gravy, and so should you :-) then the eggs and corn beef hash came and I almost passed out out was so good! I only wish I lived closer to this place so I could come here more often!!!

5/5 for pricing as the deals and single item options had great pricing. Options for $10 and under even a few $5 or less side items for light eating.
5/5 for food as the quality of food was beyond what I expected from a small diner in Phoenix (came for the weekend from California) and was impressed by the variety of food options and the actual quality of the food that was served was better than expected but the one negative was the speed of the delivery which impacts the next grade on service.
3/5 on service unfortunately. The waitress was attentive to getting me refills so I'm grateful for that but the food took a long time to be served. I understand that it's a small diner and that food is cooked to order but it probably took 20-30 minutes from ordering for the eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon(2,2,2,2)and the waitress didn't  really converse with us  or smile much but those small things can be overlooked. A good spot to check out if your in town

Joe's Diner is a cute little family run business that offers home cooked style food. I ordered a meat omelet which came with a large side of potatoes and a pancake. Everything came from the kitchen quickly and tasted so fresh like a home cooked meal. Only downside is the diner is old and seems a little run down. I think for the price the atmosphere is fitting and everything was clean.

What a disappointment!  I had the veggie omelet and my eggs were so over cooked they crumbled.  Service was slow and the place wasn't that busy.  I won't be back and suggest you can do better at other breakfast joints.  The coffee was good but since the service was bad I only had one cup -  Bummer.

Sometimes you just feel like getting up, grabbing a hat and going out to breakfast.   Meh.  I can make better eggs at home.  Scrambled eggs were dry.  Potatoes way too salty (could have used some onion).  Sausage was just OK.  $2 for two slices of toast.  I should have saved my $ and went to McDonalds.  I'm just saying ... This place didn't do it for me.  The place had lots of "regulars" in there ... older guys stopping in for their "regular dose of Joe's".  Ho hum.  I doubt if I will ever return.  So it's back in the saddle again heading to Matt's Big Breakfast.  When I want breakfast again, Matt, you're my man.

I am not sure how breakfast is, but the lunch is horrible. I had the meatball sub, the Monday special. Subway has a better meatball sub.

Service was acceptable.

What kind of tricks do you have to do to get a drink refill... She drops my food off at my table, grabs my empty beverage glass and disappears.... I took two bites and left... I'm going somewhere i can have a beverage with my breakfast...

Update for September 2017: We tried Joe's again thinking our first attempt was maybe a fluke. It was even worse this time. The food was so bad, I barely ate any of mine and the waitress never bothered to ask if everything was okay.

Original review for July 2017: We just moved to the area and came here for breakfast on 4th of July, hoping to find our new go-to breakfast spot. Unfortunately, this isn't it.

I'm not sure if they forgot about the holiday or just weren't anticipating that amount of customers, but it was busy and they were understaffed. Despite that, our waitress was very sweet and really on top of her game. She keep our coffees (which were excellent) and waters full and noticed when we didn't receive our toast. Excellent service: 5/5.

Although they serve large portions, the food was just okay. Biscuit was dry. Pork chops were low quality and over-cooked. Overpriced for the quality. Food: 2/5.

Super friendly. Joe was there greeting everyone, refilling coffee, and sharing how we uses local Arizona suppliers. Great diner food and decor. Loved the biscuits and chorizo gravy.  Will definitely be back.

My family and I were staying nearby while visiting family in Phoenix.  We had breakfast here 3 out of 5 days--the rest of the family eats eggs/meat, while I am vegan.  We were all very happy!  Everyone else said that the eggs were exceptionally fresh-tasting, and then spent the rest of the meal trying to figure out how 'fresh' tastes--apparently, it tastes great!

I was happy with toast and fruit, especially since there was homemade cherry and strawberry jam on the table.  Amazing.  

Service was fast and very friendly, and prices were very reasonable for breakfast (about 7-10 per person; less for my fruit/toast).  The space was clean and seemed accessible if you use a wheelchair (large open space near tables at the front of the restaurant).

Thank you, Joe's!

This place was great! The two lady's that helped us where extremely helpful and fast. She gave me extra whipped cream =) and the food was excellent too! Lastly the old movie style feel really set a great mood would totally recommend this place to anyone =)

My boyfriend and I were searching for local diners and we stumbled across this gem. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by Joe who introduced himself and promptly sat us at a table. We ordered lunch and were both pleased with the portion size and the food was outstanding. I noticed people complaining (on yelp) about the time it took for the food to arrive, it took the same time as a normal restaurant and we went on a fairly busy day, so I didn't see any problem and I did not feel like I was waiting long for the food at all. Overall, we both really enjoyed it and we will definitely be going back in the future.

A coffee joint down the street recommended  this place. And since I love the coffee joint, I thought that this must be good. WRONG! We were right by the door, cashiers area & had the worst service! The food was blah!! I will NOT return.

OK  I have lived here in the valley for about 10 years,  been on a search to find 'real' made from scratch sausage gravy and have finally found it!  great sausage gravy actually sausage/bacon gravy is fantastic BEST IN THE VALLEY !  Great Service super friendly staff....JOE even came over introduced himself and was very appreciative we were eating at his Diner.  I had the corned beef hash cook perfect and 3 eggs, biscuit and gravy  great meal.  I/We will return many many times  this is my breakfast spot now!  I hear the pancake are fantastic cant wait to go back.

What can't be faulted: Food and coffee are terrific. Especially the coffee. Also, I have been seated very quickly at each visit. The servers are delightfully cheerful and Joe himself comes out to speak to each table directly. It's a high-quality, old-school diner experience and well-worth the minimal price.

What is a bit of an annoyance: By applying all of that personalized service, the speed of the service suffers when they are even a bit busy. I don't believe Joe has enough help behind the line, and it's probably further hurt by his zeal for customer interaction. And it seems that maybe order turnaround time might be slowed by the apparent lack of any  computerized order management/POS system. When get your check you're supposed to pay your server, but if she's not around and you go to the front desk (because you need to get on with things), you won't find a dedicated cashier. Just a hostess. Who is very nice and cheerful.

It could be that this is how long service took back in the day, and I have been spoiled (with the other members in my party) by the super-speedy almost-flawless delivery of cold, corporate places like Chili's, Denny's, Applebee's, and other places who have teams of industrial engineers and MBA's to hone their model. In that case I fault myself.  I barely remember how things were back in 1978 or whenever.

I remain a fan and will return, but will need to keep in mind that Joe's requires more of a time investment than do other places.

I just turned 47 years old and I'm a fat chick not just a little bit of a fat chick...a fat fat chick and for me to walk away from the table and leave a sausage patty and 2 bacon sitting on the plate with one bite taken out of the bacon and had to spit that ut into a napkin has to tell you how unbelievably a****** this breakfast was this morning so awful I am dumbfounded at this point. The meat was rancid it has gone bad probably a day or two ago and they had pre cooked it and you can taste it being sour and rancid. Like I said be worse breakfast ever in my life.
Food was great, chorizo and eggs excellent as was the service. It's a relaxed atmosphere with a mix of customers. I will definitely go back.

Watch your waistline - nahh   forget it - enjoy!  This is one of our family's FAVorite breakfast hangouts.  I LOVE #2 - the 20 year old devours the Breakfast Burrito AND biscuits and gravy.  LOVE Joe's Diner for our family breakfast on the weekends.  And yes, we met Joe!

I love this place, its had a 1950's feel to it, but the food is fantastic.  I always go for the Monte Christo Sandwich, its the Saturday special, but you can get it any time, if you ask for it.  The portion sizes are very good.  They have different daily specials every day.  And if you work around the area, you can call your order and pick it up.  I took my husband for his birthday yesterday for the first time, hes a fan now too, and I am sure we will be going back there again soon.
Dined here this morning. This place is everything I could ask for as far as a breakfast joint goes. The waiters and service are excellent

We live across the street from Joe's Diner, and never got a chance to go because it's only open 7-2. The diner seems to be one of those places that has been around for a good long while and the Clientele all looked to be regulars. I ordered the pancakes, and there's something about them that makes me nod my head agreeably. They're more on the hearty side than sweet, and you don't even need to douse it in syrup to appreciate them. They stand alone and are good even with just butter. The rest of the food was standard diner food. I can't say I love the place, I don't think it was my vibe, but I can see why they have regulars, and I respect that. They're a plain-jane type of diner that delivers the staples of breakfast food just fine.
Friendly customer service with Joe himself making his meet and greet rounds while working. Impressive. Tasty food. Well done Joe.

Ummm yeahhhhhhh..... I don't know about this place.
My food look so sad.... I was sad to even eat it. My pancakes was so soggy. My hash browns was over cooked.. my potatoes were so soft.. *sad face* no taste at all.. And the lady was in a rush to get my mom and I out. Asked for napkins, she have me 2 napkins... 

I will not be coming out.

Denny's and IHOP fail to stack up against Joe's and their amazing food and reasonable prices. 

I was in Phoenix on my last day in Arizona when my friend and his girlfriend suggested this place for brunch before I caught my flight back to Oakland. I am glad I went along. The menu consisted of your typical diner food (assorted omelets, breakfast specials ect) and everything was priced under $10. I let my friend order for me since she knew what was good. Apparently, I could not leave AZ without trying the chicken fried steak with chorizo gravy and two eggs and home-style potatoes ($8.79). GET IT! The chicken friend steak itself was pretty good. But, that chorizo gravy really took it to another level.The eggs were nice and runny. The potatoes were okay but then I spattered them with gravy. I loved it.

The atmosphere was nice. Pictures of 50's stars such as Merilyn Monroe and Elvis adorned the walls. 

Service was kinda slow but I think that server was new. 

In short: Great food, amazing portion size for the price, 50's atmosphere, CHORIZO GRAVY! I would love to come back here next time I'm in AZ and I recommend you guys stop by too if you have the chance

Awesome Breakfast!  I am sure their other offerings are just as tasty here.  There was plently of parking plus it is very inviting and spacious inside.  There are not lines events though the food is worthy of mass enjoyment. But don't tell that Triple D dude...his appearance ruins the best kept secrets.

Stopping in around 9am on New Year's Day I grabbed a seat at the counter.  All my typical breakfast favorites were on the menu.  My decision wasn't easy.  Ordering a cup of their house coffee, I later read this is a local AZ coffee, Arbuckles. 
Torn between the corned beef hash and Joe's Favorite #1, I decided on the #1, add sausage.  Now the #1 already came with one egg, a biscuit with sausage gravy and a ham slice but I wanted sausage too.  Damn gluttony and my protein craving.  The breakfast rocked!   The gravy on the biscuit was so damn tasty and my over easy egg was perfectly over easy!  
In the middle of my meal out comes Joe with a tray of little bowls of black eyed peas over rice, to provid everyone in the restaurant a little good luck for the New Year.  Quite a tasty little treat.  
The service was quick and friendly.  
I may live within walking distance of a VERY popular breakfast spot but I can see myself driving to Joe's and taking my visiting friends and family with me.

Went to a late breakfast here with my family on Saturday and were not impressed at all. Our waitress Carrie made you feel like an inconvenience for being there and she was not pleasent at all. When we sent back the waffle twice she was no where to be found. If it were not for Joe coming by our table and another waitress named Layla helping I would be rating one star. Joe is the owner and introduced us and made us feel very welcome. If this was based off of Joe and Layla alone I would be giving 5 stars! The pancakes were VERY good, the waffle was sent back twice till it finally came out crispy(thank you Joe and Layla for making sure we left happy). As a fellow server my advice is for Joe to get more severs like Layla and your reviews will be all 5 stars. Definitely asking for her if we end up coming back to try this little place again.

Last breakfast was great. Good good and prompt service.

Love the breakfast bowl. With the side of chorizo gravy!

Good coffee. Good food. 
There was no wait for breakfast the sunday I went.
The hostess was prompt to greet us and seat us.
The server was friendly and got our order right...always a good sign!!

I am adding this spot to my breakfast list.

YUMMY! this place is a classic diner, and i love it. 
good service, comfort food, and at a great price. 
i cant wait to go back. :)

I came here for the first time earlier this week and I love the very quiet, humble environment.  I had the corn beef hash-- delicious!!  I can't wait to come back again soon.  They also serve the best coffee!! The staff are very friendly too.

We went to the new location last weekend (in the rain), and I must say, I was a little disappointed. The new location doesn't have the personality that the old one did. It really just feels like any old diner. Also, we sat next to the window and I noticed the window sill was covered in dead bugs....gotta pay attention to details guys, that does not make me want to eat. The food was still fine, nothing too special though. I hope they step up their game in the future.

The bf and I went to get breakfast at Joe's yesterday and it was shockingly good! I didn't expect much, despite the good reviews, hence my hesitation to go to this place after living nearby for over a year. The food is simple, but good. The bacon was super crispy, which I really enjoyed. Their biscuits are buttery and delicious. Their potatoes were ok. The bf liked the biscuits and gravy and the coffee was good. I'll definitely be back soon! Ps- they're going to be moving over to 7th ave soon.

Beware of the breakfast burrito and the menu on line.  I ordered a Breakfast Burrito with NO meat and no sour cream for take out.  I asked for extra salsa.  I go to pick up my burrito and it was just an average size burrito with no extra salsa on the side.  I had to ask for the salsa and when I went to pay I was charged over $10.00.  Yes........$10.00.  I asked for a manager who did refund me my money but no discount off the burrito. I left.  Beware!  Chaotic and unorganized for sure!

When you want a solid, good old-fashioned diner breakfast, this is the place to come. The food is pretty standard (although the waffles and strawberries were a standout!!), but when it comes to a diner breakfast, that's exactly what I want. Solid favorites and an endless cup of coffee.

My only complaint is that I wish they had a diaper changing station in the bathroom (new mom trying to figure out restaurant eating with a little one)! But certainly not a deal breaker for me, I'll be back for sure.

This place is a dump! From the scowl face hostess  who won't look you in the eye smile or bother to tell your waitress you have been seated to the owner who will tell you This  restaurant is not for you with his mouth but F..ck you with his glaring Manson eyes. 
Leave your please, thank you, and excuse me or any kind of manners at home because they are going to get you nowhere fast.
Be prepared to get what your served whether it's what you ordered or not and if it's not what you ordered your still going to pay for it! I'm serious about the owner after showing him that what was on the menu was not what we were ordering he Lets us know  Joes Dinner was not the restaurant for us. 
So if you want a place to let your confederate flag down or talk about how America is going  be great again this place is for you. I read another review call this place a greasy spoon. I'm not sure if that was a compliment but I would call   it a cross between a Mel's Dinner in a Walmart  wherever chainsaw massacre was filmed.  I left this place feeling like I needed a shower.
The owner made it clear if you have any sort of standard you have set for your self set it lower and this place is for you! Oh and if you don't feel like putting on a clean shirt or for that matter no shirt no shoes this restaurant is for you.

OMG get the chorizo omelet!!! 
The place is cutely decorated and the service is super friendly, though a little slow. I am a booth girl, so I was happy to see that most of the seating up front was booths. I don't like tables and hate chairs.
When I see biscuits and gravy on a menu, I am already in love. Also, they don't have it on the menu, but try the chorizo gravy on your biscuits. We only knew about it because Joe himself came to our table. In face, he visited a lot of patrons while we were there.
The potatoes weren't anything fancy, but man oh man, that omelet was amazing. I am still thinking about it!

This place has good food but great service. They where definitely on top of things and the place was packed, it's refreshing to see someplace that tries hard in central Phoenix. Will be going back for the biscuits and gravy. The scrambled eggs where super yummy too! It would be nice if they had hash browns but, I guess you can't get everything. Enjoy this place for the middle class diner it is.

This has become one of our favorite breakfast spots. The staff is always nice, the food is yummy, and the portions are huge. We have never had to wait to be seated, or very long for our food. It's definitely classic diner breakfast, but it's not too greasy. The coffee is good too!

Dolores G and I came here for breakfast before walking the Melrose shops. Upon walking in, I was struck by how outdated this new location looked. I was expecting more of what their last location looked like. After reading some of the yelp tips, I decided on their pancakes. I ordered the short stack (2 pancakes), added 2 eggs, and a side of corn beef hash. Total was $8.50. Very inexpensive. The food was tasty and I was in a food coma after finishing my pancakes. Typical breakfast fare. 

Service was okay. At first the server was very attentive and then we hadn't seen her for like 15 minutes. Our empty plates were stacked at the edge of the table and we waited awhile while waiting for our checks. Finally I went up to the front and asked if we paid up front. She said we could pay but I still wasn't clear if we were supposed to or not. 

I think this is a good addition to the Melrose strip. I don't know that I would come back over other breakfast places in the area but I think this is heads and tails over Melrose Kitchen (around the corner) for value and quality of the food.

What a disappointment. Un-full glass of beer. Ordered a burger and onion rings. The lady who was expideting the food was so confused. There were 4 entrees and 3 salads waiting to be delivered. She kept looking a tickets and squinting seeming confused. She decided to deliver the cold salads before the hot entrees. My burger was a joke. The bun was mangled and part of it was missing. One piece of romaine lettuce that was 90% rib, a grim slice of tomato that was mostly white core and the size of a 50 cent piece and my fresh mozerella in a weird pile in the middle of the beef. Once probably warm and melty now a congealed blob. My waiter delivered a bottle of mustard and the most nasty bottle of ketchup ever, with dried spilled ketchup from some other diner, i didn't want to touch it. I asked for my onions rings, he left and came back and told me he forgot to order them. I passed on a re-order. The beef was tasty, but everthing else was way below par. This was a burger sale night, so maybe they don't care, but this was orginally priced at $12.99, burger only no sides. Not coming back here ever.

We went to Joes for the first time yesterday morning.  We only had to wait a few minutes to be seated. I ordered the breakfast bowl and my wife had the number two breakfast with pancakes.    My breakfast bowl was mostly potatoes with very over done scrambled eggs on top.  My wife said her pancakes were ok but the eggs were tough and rubbery.

Our waitress while pleasant enough, took our order then disappeared.  We did not see her again until she brought our bill.  We had to ask a bus boy to refill our drinks.

All in all the food was not impressive and the service sub par. We won't be going back.

Joe's Diner is very aptly named. The owner, who sometimes comes out and visits with the customers, is named Joe, and it definitely serves diner food. We've been here three or four times, both as a couple and as a larger group. The servers do a good job keeping coffee cups filled and the food is tasty. I love the chorizo gravy and the chicken fried steak is very good. The various jams/jellies they offer are also delicious. This is a good place to go for an inexpensive, filling breakfast and also is a Yelp Cashback participant.

Joe's Diner was ok...I almost walked out because it smelled like eggs sitting in the trash or dishwater.  That grossed me out, but I was hungry and wanted to try a traditional breakfast.  The prices are reasonable and the food is good, not mouth watering, but solid food food.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.  Pancakes cooked perfectly.  Coffee was delicious.  Service was good.  Potatoes were good.  Honestly it's good food, but this place just smells.

Always busy - which is a good sign!  Sometimes means you wait for service, but breakfast is always good.  Great pancakes, coffee is locally roasted and decent, and the owners are always around.  Good neighborhood diner.  Great for kids - they love it here.
Great little place, good food, super-friendly service!

so I've been here 3 times now.
First time a friend brought me as she knew one of the staff.
Fabulous service and great food for a reasonable price.
Second time,pretty much the same.
Third time,great service,food was good.
Was dining with 3 companions and they managed to get all our orders slightly wrong even though confirming them at the outset.
One companion ended up with another dish all together.
All the food was good,we were all hungry and posession is 9/10 of the law.
Good thing I didn't have my heart totally set on what I ordered or I might be disappointed.
I'll certainly be back for another mystery breakfast.

Drove by the diner the other day and noticed it replaced the Chinese buffet.   I was stoked so today the hubby and I went there for a Sunday morning breakfast; something we used to do a lot when we were first married.  We got there right before 10 and had no problem parking and were seated right away.  The owner was our waitress and the staff was friendly.  We gad some delicious Arbuckle's coffee which was hot too!  Love they had Sweet N' Lo too.  The hubby had the Western Omelet which came HUGE with a generous side of seasoned home fries and toast or buscuit.  He had whole wheat toast and enjoyed the homemade apple butter as well.  I had 2 eggs over easy (perfect ) which came with the same huge side of home fries and toast or biscuit.   I had the toast and homemade blueberry jam which was FANTASTIC! So glad we went and tried this great local breakfast place and we will be back!
Great place! Joe and Joan are about as friendly as you can get and the 50's decor is a sweet and charming way to start the day. Delicious, friendly, and the coffee is mmmmmm gooood!

A greasy spoon if every I've been to one!

This place reminds me of the Midwest staple diner, full of good food and great people. David and I have been here several times and tried multiple menu items. Everything has been wonderful. I'm partial to their pancakes which don't sit in my stomach like a sack of lead as is the case with other pancakes I've had. The bacon is good, too.

I needed a place to eat breakfast while my stuff was en route from NC -- Joe's Diner is nearby so decided to give it a try.  The place was packed, so I snagged a spot at the bar. 

The breakfast burrito looked good, and it was -- huge too. More than enough for one person.  It came with a side of salsa and sour cream. The sour cream helped to cool it down in your mouth, and, well, there isn't much I won't eat sour cream on anyway. 

The coffee was just okay -- a bit too strong in my opinion. 

They make homemade pies for the holidays for you -- too bad I'm watching calories or one of those would be mighty tempting! 

I'm sure I'll come here again -- it isn't someplace I'll find myself dying to go every weekend though. 

Cons:
--Parking (lack thereof)
